channel.title: Uncategorized – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies
channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

image.title: Uncategorized – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies

item.title: [Agency Affiliates] Children’s Mental Health Week
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: In the United Kingdom, they’ve been celebrating Children’s Mental Health Week for several years. We would like to do our part in bringing that celebration to this side of the Atlantic Ocean. The theme for this year’s Children’s Mental Health Week is Growth Together. For us that means educational content for nannies and charges about […]
item.content:encoded:
In the United Kingdom, they’ve been celebrating Children’s Mental Health Week for several years. We would like to do our part in bringing that celebration to this side of the Atlantic Ocean.

The theme for this year’s Children’s Mental Health Week is Growth Together. For us that means educational content for nannies and charges about growth mindset and resilience. We have a whole week of programming planned for the nannies of North Carolina.

And we have collaboration opportunities available for you!

1. Share information about Children’s Mental Health Week

Use the image above or simply share our Facebook post to get the word out and show yourself to be a partner in this endeavor. It is free and has high returns.

2. Post Positive Phrases to your Social Media

Take the week to encourage some neuro-linguistic programming through language that encourages growth and resilience. Here are some quick language substitutions that pay dividends. And you can teach them to the nannies in your network!

3. The Money Ask: Sponsor a printable deck of grounding cards.

Throughout the week, we are hoping to be able to give away one or more decks of printable grounding cards (they help nannies and charges come up with creative ways to regulate emotion; no growth can happen when dysregulated) to participants in our activities. We’d love to give you visibility by letting people know that you’ve covered the costs of the prize, and we’ll even let you determine winners. Visit this page to see the cards and the price points so you know how much we are asking you to spend, one deck is great and more than one deck is phenomenal.

4. The Zoom Ask: On Sunday we are hoping to have a movie night from 8 to 10 pm.

The movie will be related to the material and theme of the week. May we use your Zoom to host this online movie night? You’ll get full branding rights and a welcome and closing remarks opportunity. CLAIMED!

item.title: An Open Letter to Apple
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: To Whom it May Concern at Apple, Inc.: We have become aware that in the latest update of iOS, there has been an autocorrect entry to turn the word referring to a collective of domestic employees: nannies into the possessive word: Nannie’s. While we do not deny that there may be several persons in the […]
item.content:encoded:
To Whom it May Concern at Apple, Inc.:

We have become aware that in the latest update of iOS, there has been an autocorrect entry to turn the word referring to a collective of domestic employees: nannies into the possessive word: Nannie’s. While we do not deny that there may be several persons in the world named Nannie who may in fact own things, we doubt this is the usual case for the use of the word nannies given the scope and depth of the in-home childcare industry.

We are aware that additional steps may be taken to enter the automatic word-substitution dictionary to change the entry offered as a default by you. We find this insufficient. We know that your dictionary can learn new words and if the typer does indeed mistype objects belonging to Nannie regularly, that their phone will learn.

We respectfully request that this nannies Nannie’s autocorrect entry be removed in the next planned update.

Yours,
The North Carolina Professional Association of Nannie’s Nannies

We, further, call upon other nanny organizations and individual nannies to join us in our call for Apple to correct their autocorrect error. Turn the page for ways you can help!

item.title: You Deserve a Little Something
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: It is National Nanny Recognition Week and you, fair nanny, have worked hard this year. COVID has been no joke and added a lot of stress, school has resumed in person even though your charges aren’t vaccinated, and the prices of everything have gone up! Well, not everything. Here’s how we are going to recognize […]
item.content:encoded:
It is National Nanny Recognition Week and you, fair nanny, have worked hard this year. COVID has been no joke and added a lot of stress, school has resumed in person even though your charges aren’t vaccinated, and the prices of everything have gone up!

Well, not everything. Here’s how we are going to recognize YOU!

For the week of National Nanny Recognition Week, from 12:01 am Sunday to 11:59 pm Saturday (we wish it could be midnight, but our shopping cart software has limitations), you can pick up a Supporting Nanny Membership for 50% of its listed price.

You’ll just need a coupon code: DQVRTP8G

Set your reminders and snag your membership so you can instantly enjoy all of the perks of a Supporting Member for a full year.

Shop now

item.title: COVID Vaccination for the Nanny
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: As some of you who already follow our Facebook page may have seen, nannies are slated to receive the vaccine in Phase 1b, Subgroup Group 3: Childcare Workers. This is where we are planned for and this is where we need to be showing up. According to Governor Cooper, we are already in Phase 1b. […]
item.content:encoded:
As some of you who already follow our Facebook page may have seen, nannies are slated to receive the vaccine in Phase 1b, Subgroup Group 3: Childcare Workers. This is where we are planned for and this is where we need to be showing up.

According to Governor Cooper, we are already in Phase 1b.

According to Senator Jackson, we should expect vaccinations to start on the 24th of February.

The vaccination delivery is being done on a county-by-county basis even though as a state it was decided where nannies place into the groupings and subgroupings and even though as a state it was decided that we are in Phase 1b. To illustrate this, at the time of writing this post, Wake County has announced to its county residents that it is still in Phase 1a despite the Governor due to supply shortages. So it is all a big mess.

We here at your North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies hope to provide an informational clearing house about this vaccination extravaganza of confusion. We cannot do this alone. If you know what your county is up to, please let your local nanny community know and also please let us know so that we can add it to this post for any nannies who haven’t been connected with your local community yet. How to let us know? Leave a comment.

Here is what we know (in alphabetical order of county):

Durham County

This link will tell you what phase they’re on and you’re in. When you’re eligible you call and make an appointment.

We have heard that they are requiring employers to call and make appointments for employee nannies, so prepare your employer for this duty should it become necessary.

Franklin County

Use their online vaccination scheduling portal.

Granville County

252-295-1503 Call that number.

Orange County

A multi-step process which starts by filling out a survey to indicate that you are interested and to assess how you qualify. Start HERE and they’ll email you next steps. Say yes to the survey page that asks about Phase 1b and then yes again to the survey page that asks about childcare workers.

Rutherford County

Despite the timeline set by Governor Cooper, it appears this county is still in Group 2 and hasn’t expanded to Group 3. When this happens it is usually due to short supply. Put yourself on the waiting list, here.

Vance County

252-295-1503 Call that number.

Wake County

A multi-step process which starts by filling out a survey to indicate that you are interested and to assess how you qualify. Start HERE.

We are “those who work in child care”.

In addition, there is a number to call if the online system isn’t working.

Hospital systems and pharmacies are also independently vaccinating in parallel with county health departments. Here is what we know about those (in alphabetical order):

Neighbor Health

Located in Raleigh. Services provided through the UNC Hospitals system. Sign up through this link.

UNC Healthcare

Visit this link. They open new appointment slots daily at ~ 1pm through the UNC MyChart portal.

item.title: WinterFest Zoom Collaboration Needed (Agency Affiliates)
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Greetings Agency Affiliates! We are hoping to collaborate with one of you to throw our annual WinterFest holiday bash (and All Members Meeting). If you have a paid Zoom where we can have meetings of unlimited time and are willing to donate that access to us for an evening (of your choice), please send an […]
item.content:encoded:
Greetings Agency Affiliates! We are hoping to collaborate with one of you to throw our annual WinterFest holiday bash (and All Members Meeting).

If you have a paid Zoom where we can have meetings of unlimited time and are willing to donate that access to us for an evening (of your choice), please send an email to social@ncpan.org.

In return, you will get as much or as little publicity by name as you want, as well as programming control for one hour and fifteen minutes of the WinterFest celebration. The schedule will be as follows:

5:30 pm (15 minutes) All Members Meeting in a breakout room for members / Your choice of programming in the main room.
5:45 pm (15 minutes) Awards ceremony. Breakout rooms closed.
6 pm (1 hour) Your programming.
7 pm (2 hours) Nanny movie.

We will offer you gratis memberships and discounts to the Equipment Shop to give out as awards if you choose to do games during your programming.

Once again, please do get in touch with social@ncpan.org if this sounds like a collaboration you are interested in.

If you are unfamiliar with what our WinterFest celebrations are like, we encourage you to read about past WinterFests.

item.title: Public Schools Suspended for Remainder of School Year
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Governor Roy Cooper gave a press conference today (Friday, April 24th) at lunch time. He said a lot of things, but only one that related to nannies and it is: Public schools are all the way out for the whole rest of the school year. For those of you with school aged charges, we know […]
item.content:encoded:
Governor Roy Cooper gave a press conference today (Friday, April 24th) at lunch time. He said a lot of things, but only one that related to nannies and it is:

Public schools are all the way out for the whole rest of the school year.

For those of you with school aged charges, we know that adding Governess to your nanny title wasn’t something you wanted forced upon you, and especially not without additional pay. We get it. So if you haven’t seen the mental health resources for nannies in this trying time, take ample advantage of them. You deserve it.

In addition, fire up your ongoing draft copy of your resume and RIGHT NOW add Governess to your position title at your current position. It is what you are doing.

governess (noun) — a woman who is employed to take charge of a child’s upbringing, education, etc.

Dictionary.com

Like it or hate it, we’ve just gained ourselves a resume booster because that “education” piece has fallen to us. So capture it before it gets forgotten and immortalize it on that resume!

item.title: (triad) Free Hand Sanitizer
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Triad nannies, especially those of you in Greensboro, go get your essential working selves some personal protective hand sanitizer … free! Hat tip to Nanny Michelle W for making us aware of this awesome offer from Fainting Goat Spirits. Make sure you click the button on Facebook to “embiggen” the image as it is longer than […]
item.content:encoded:
Triad nannies, especially those of you in Greensboro, go get your essential working selves some personal protective hand sanitizer … free!

Hat tip to Nanny Michelle W for making us aware of this awesome offer from Fainting Goat Spirits.

Make sure you click the button on Facebook to “embiggen” the image as it is longer than Facebook’s image preview. More information to read.

item.title: Financial Options for COVID-19
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Angela Johnson Sutherland of Ask the Nanny and the US Nanny Association recently interviewed Kathy Webb, president of Homework Solutions (the premier nanny payroll solution) about financial benefits and options available for nannies and newborn care specialists and doulas. They discussed the Families First Corona Virus Response Act, the Payroll Protection Act, the difference between […]
item.content:encoded:
Angela Johnson Sutherland of Ask the Nanny and the US Nanny Association recently interviewed Kathy Webb, president of Homework Solutions (the premier nanny payroll solution) about financial benefits and options available for nannies and newborn care specialists and doulas.

They discussed the Families First Corona Virus Response Act, the Payroll Protection Act, the difference between a furlough and being laid off, unemployment insurance, what happens if you’ve been paid under the table (finger wagging but also solutions), and the stimulus money provided to every American earning less than $75,000/year.

item.title: Explaining HB6201
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: You are an employee. You are not an independent contractor. Therefore, your employer has at least one employee: you. That means, you and your employer qualify as falling under this law. The law goes in to effect tomorrow. Learn about the PTO you are required, legally, to receive. (and your employer can receive reimbursement for […]
item.content:encoded:
You are an employee. You are not an independent contractor. Therefore, your employer has at least one employee: you. That means, you and your employer qualify as falling under this law. The law goes in to effect tomorrow. Learn about the PTO you are required, legally, to receive. (and your employer can receive reimbursement for providing you with)

WATCH THE EXPLAINER VIDEO

item.title: #AddChildcare
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: We’ve noticed a lot of lists going around thanking the amazing folks keeping the world together right now. We think they are awesome. We just have one tiiiiiiiiiiny addition to make in keeping with our call for an industry standard change. Feel free to drop this image in the comments of those posts or share […]
item.content:encoded:
We’ve noticed a lot of lists going around thanking the amazing folks keeping the world together right now. We think they are awesome. We just have one tiiiiiiiiiiny addition to make in keeping with our call for an industry standard change.

Feel free to drop this image in the comments of those posts or share this post in its entirety.

Childcare workers, even those of you who aren’t nannies, we see you!

And for those responding on social medias which aren’t Facebook, we’ve got the image for you to download directly.
